thread.title: Milwaukee warming sites see surge amid cold weather | FOX6 Milwaukee
thread.title_full: Milwaukee warming sites see surge amid cold weather | FOX6 Milwaukee

author: Christina Van Zelst
title: Milwaukee warming sites see surge amid cold weather | FOX6 Milwaukee
text:
Milwaukee warming sites see surge amid cold weather Warming centers in Milwaukee are filled to capacity and outreach programs say there are more people than ever without a place to get warm.
The Brief Warming centers in Milwaukee are filled to capacity and outreach programs say there are more people than ever without a place to get warm. Warming shelters will stay open through March, with hours typically from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m. Anyone that needs shelter or help is encouraged to call 211. WAUWATOSA, Wis. - Warming centers in Milwaukee are filled to capacity and outreach programs say there are more people than ever without a place to get warm.
 Since 3:45 a.m. Wednesday, Eva Welch has been up, unable to shake the thought that people might be left in the cold. Welch is the co-executive director for Milwaukee's Street Angels. It's a mobile outreach program that serves people without a home.
"We do have concerns for the people that are disconnected," Welch said. "I had an MPD officer call me trying to find warming for people."
SIGN UP TODAY: Get daily headlines, breaking news emails from FOX6 News
She said in the last two years, they've seen a 120% increase in unsheltered people.
"The increase we’ve been seeing is from tiny children to the elderly," Welch said.
It comes after the organization helped people move out of park and rides earlier this year.
Related
article Milwaukee warming shelters open; preparation for influx of people Many emergency warming shelters opened their doors on Monday, Nov. 25 across Milwaukee.
Welch said some of those people pitched in to get a hotel together to stay warm, but it's the people they lost touch with she worries about.
"Not only may there not be enough room for people, but not everybody knows about the warming rooms," Welch said.
Repairers of the Breach, a warming center in Milwaukee, is seeing an increase too.
Executive director James West said on Wednesday night, they were over capacity.
FREE DOWNLOAD: Get breaking news alerts in the FOX6 News app for iOS or Android
"We have all three floors being utilized for our overflow," West said. "Same thing at night."
Both organizations believe higher rent, the economy and COVID-19 assistance programs ending could play a role in increasing numbers.
Warming site locations Guest House of Milwaukee – 1216 N 13th Street Milwaukee, WI 53205 Unity Lutheran Church – 1025 E Oklahoma Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53207 St Ben’s- 930 W State Street Milwaukee, WI 53233 Repairer’s of the Breach- 1335 W Vliet Street Milwaukee, WI 53205 Warming shelters will stay open through March, with hours typically from 7 p.m. to 7 a.m. Anyone that needs shelter or help is encouraged to call 211.
The Source The information in this post was produced by FOX6 News.
